definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: He has been Colonel of the Welsh Guards since 1975.
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯于1975年开始担任威尔士禁卫军陆军上校。

sentences.english: Prince William is the colonel of the Irish Guards.
sentences.chinese: 威廉王子是爱尔兰士兵中的陆军上校。

sentences.english: Prakash Tewari works in the defense ministry in India and is a former army colonel.
sentences.chinese: 在印度国防部工作和是一位前陆军上校。

sentences.english: Colonel Qaddafi called his withdrawal tactical.
sentences.chinese: 陆军上校卡扎菲声称他的撤退是战略。

sentences.english: Indian army colonel killed in gunfight in Kashmir .
sentences.chinese: 印度陆军上校在克什米尔枪战中丧生。

sentences.english: By the end of the war, Allenby had reached the rank of brevet colonel.
sentences.chinese: 战争结束后，艾伦比晋升为陆军上校。

sentences.english: Colonel Poulsen received a box by post.
sentences.chinese: 陆军上校Poulsen收到邮局送来的一个盒子。

definition: commander (= UK and US Navy equivalent)
high ranking officer in Chinese army/colonel
junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
captain (= UK and US Navy equivalent)
lieutenant commander (= UK and US Navy equivalent)
middle ranking officer in Chinese army/lieutenant colonel/commander
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
